alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 2:27AM EST until December 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall runoff continues. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and North Central Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 245 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 227 AM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rainfall runoff in the advisory area. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincoln, Millinocket, Dover-Foxcroft, Howland, Patten, Brownville Junction, Milo, East Millinocket, Medway, Springfield, Lake View Plantation, Ebeemee, Licoln Township, Orneville, southern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Sherman Station, White Cap Mountain, Baxter State Park, Frenchtown and Reed Plantation. - Numerous reports of flooding inside the advisory area impacting several roadways. - For Flood Safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
